newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Shenzhen B index rises on gains by local stocks.
newsitem.headline: Shenzhen B index rises on gains by local stocks.

text.p: Shenzhen's B share index rose on Tuesday on demand for Shenzhen-based counters and the A share index fell slightly in record turnover, brokers said.
The B share index rose 0.99 points, or 1.10 percent, to 91.30, with turnover increasing to HK$18.21 million from HK$14.38 million on Monday.

Brokers said the rise was due in part to speculative buying of Shenzhen-based shares, such as Shenbao, which surged HK$0.62, or 29.81 percent, to HK$2.70 on a single trade of 100 shares, brokers said. The issue will definitely fall back in future sessions and in turn pull down the index, they added.
Chiwan Petroleum was the second best performer on speculative buying, brokers said. The issue soared HK$0.25 or 7.35 percent to HK$3.65 on thin volume of 10,000 shares.
Konka, which fell sharply on Monday, rallied HK$0.44, or 6.98 percent, to HK$6.74, with 8,000 shares changing hands.
The counter is due to go ex-rights on October 30, the Shenzhen bourse has said.

Building materials producer Fangda rose HK$0.35, or 6.14 percent, to HK$6.05 on trade of 421,700 shares. Brokers said the counter's recent steady advance was due to investor confidence in the firm's results this year.
Dadonghai was the most active issue and rose HK$0.04 to HK$1.37 on volume of 974,900 shares.

Shenzhen SEZ Real Estate rose HK$0.03 to HK$3.06 in trading of 402,400 shares. Demand for Shenzhen-based property from Hong Kong should pick up after mid-1997 when the territory is handed back to China, which would benefit the company, analysts said.
Hainan Pearl River, the sharpest loser, dropped HK$0.05 or 2.50 percent to HK$1.95, on trade of 23,700 shares, in speculative selling, brokers said.
The A share market retreated slightly on profit-taking late in the afternoon session, brokers said.

The A share index inched down 0.16 points, or 0.04 percent, 391.03 as turnover swelled to a record 16.40 billion yuan from 14.77 billion the previous session. The composite index edged up 0.02 points, or 0.01 percent, to finish at 363.89.
Financial issues were among the biggest gainers on buying triggered by a report in the China Securities newspaper Beijing is considering a cut in bank reserve ratios, brokers said.
Shenzhen Development Bank surged 1.19 yuan, or 7.14 percent, to 17.85 yuan on massive trade of 88.49 million shares.
The newspaper quoted central bank president Dai Xianglong as saying Beijing plans to reduce bank reserve requirements in the future. But he did not provide a timetable for the cut.
Sports shoe maker Qingdao Doublestars, which had performed strongly over the past few sessions, slumped 1.35 yuan or 7.11 percent to 17.65 yuan.
Heilongjiang-based Mudanjiang Petrochemical Co Ltd, which listed 66 million A shares in Shenzhen on Tuesday, closed the session at 13.86 yuan.
